SENT.plain: Cleavage fragment length polymorphism analysis with silver staining visualization (CFLPA-SS) was used for the detection of mutations previously detected by single strand conformation (SSCA) or heteroduplex analyses (HA); in order to assess this new method for mutation screening

The analysed mutations include single nucleotide transitions, transversions, a deletion and a duplication in the following genes: CFTR (cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator), COL4A5 (collagen type 4 alpha 5 chain), PKD1 (polycystic kidney disease 1), and FGFR3 (fibroblast growth factor receptor 3)
Peripheral blood leukocyte genomic DNA was isolated, amplified by polymerase chain reaction (PCR), and then cleaved by Cleavase I enzyme at different temperatures
Electrophoresis of the fragments on denaturing polyacrylamide gel was followed by silver staining for 1 min
All 13 mutations investigated were reproducibly detected
CFLPA-SS proved to be a reliable method for mutation detection and more rapid than SSCA and HA
